newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan says all Lima hostages held in one room.
newsitem.headline: Japan says all Lima hostages held in one room.

text.p: All of the hostages seized by Peruvian rebels at the Japanese ambassador's residence in Lima are held in one large room with glass windows, apparently to deter any police attack, a Japanese Foreign Ministry spokesman said.
"We learned that the guerrilla group faxed Peru media organisations," the spokesman Ken Shimanouchi told a news briefing early on Thursday.
"This fax said the hostages were being held in one large room with glass windows, meaning that if there were any explosions there would be many injured."
The hostages include Peruvian Foreign Minister Francisco Tudela and Japanese Ambassador Morihisa Aoki as well as the ambassadors to Peru from at least 15 other countries.
Shimanouchi said they also included at least 120 Japanese nationals or Peruvians of Japanese ancestry.
Japanese Foreign Minister Yukihiko Ikeda was expected to leave Tokyo around midday (0300 GMT) for Lima to help in trying to resolve the crisis.
